The worker for God should put forth the highest mental and moral energies with which nature, cultivation, and the grace of God have endowed him; but his 
                                                                           538
success will be proportionate to the degree of consecration and self-sacrifice in which his work is done, rather than to either natural or acquired endowments. Earnest, continuous endeavor to acquire qualifications for usefulness is necessary; but unless God works with humanity, nothing good can be accomplished. Divine grace is the great element of saving power; without it all human effort is unavailing.
